def_en: When a baby bird, insect, or other animal hatches, or when it is hatched, it comes out of its egg by breaking the shell.
When an egg hatches or when a bird, insect, or other animal hatches an egg, the egg breaks open and a baby comes out.
If you hatch a plot or a scheme, you think of it and work it out.

def_cn: （船甲板上的）舱口，舱口盖
def_en: A hatch is an opening in the deck of a ship, through which people or cargo can go. You can also refer to the door of this opening as a hatch.

def_cn: （墙上或屋顶的）小窗口;（尤指厨房和餐厅间传递菜肴等的）小窗口，传菜口
def_en: A hatch is an opening in a ceiling or a wall, especially between a kitchen and a dining room, which you can pass something such as food through.

def_cn: 做好准备（迎接挑战）；未雨绸缪
def_en: If someone battens down the hatches, they prepare themselves so that they will be able to survive a coming difficulty or crisis.
